meanings.definition: The process of forming or producing grains or granules.
meanings.sent1: The granulation of sugar involves turning it into small grains.
meanings.sent2: The granulation of salt is a common process in food production.
meanings.sent3: I tried to explain the granulation of sand to my little brother, but he thought I was talking about making sandcastles.
meanings.sent4: The granulation of thoughts in her mind created a beautiful mosaic of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The granulation of metal under the microscope looked like a galaxy of tiny stars.

meanings.definition: A small, grain-like mass or particle.
meanings.sent1: The baker added a pinch of granulation to the dough for texture.
meanings.sent2: The granulation of sand on the beach sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The granulation of chocolate chips in the cookie dough made it extra delicious.
meanings.sent4: Each granulation of sand on the shore held a tiny secret within.
meanings.sent5: The granulation of sugar on the donut made it irresistible to the children.

meanings.definition: The appearance of small, grain-like projections on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The granulation on the tree bark gave it a rough texture.
meanings.sent2: The granulation on the skin was caused by the allergic reaction.
meanings.sent3: The granulation on the painting made it look like it was covered in tiny bumps.
meanings.sent4: The granulation on the wall created an interesting pattern of shadows.
meanings.sent5: The granulation on the leaf made it look like it was covered in miniature mountains.
